channel.title: Company prosecuted | Dangerous lamp recall | Public lighting and security | Battery energy storage plan for regional Aust | Plus products
channel.description: In this issue: Public lighting, LEDs and safety: it's complicated

item.title: Miniature SMD LEDs by Bivar
item.description: Nowadays, LEDs are mainly associated with energy-efficient lighting, but we should not forget about their signalling function which is still very important.

item.title: What does a Partnership of the future look like?
item.description: Companies everywhere are increasingly digitalising all aspects of their operations to power customer experience and improve business resilience.

item.title: The evolution and advancement of High Density Fibre Optic infrastructure networks
item.description: The demand for high density solutions has been driven by a range of factors, including data centre and telecom carrier requirements and the miniaturization of components and connector types.

item.title: Public lighting, LEDs and safety: it's complicated
item.description: Bright lighting might be the first thing that comes to mind when thinking about security in public places, but scratch the surface and you'll find a more complex picture.

item.title: Cathodic protection registration: streamlined online
item.description: Using an electric current or electrically dissimilar metal, cathodic protection devices protect submerged and underground metallic structures from corrosion.

item.title: Call for reform after dangerous lamp recall
item.description: Following Kmart's urgent recall of the 'Anko'-branded Marmo Table Lamp, Lighting Council Australia has called for further action on enforcement of compliance.

item.title: Ambitious battery energy storage planned for regional Aust
item.description: ACEnergy is calling for industry collaboration to introduce reforms that will expedite the rollout of renewable energy projects.

item.title: Company prosecuted for ignoring safety requirements
item.description: The construction company had been excavating and installing NBN cabling near a gas pipeline without a permit.

item.title: Comms Connect Melbourne
item.description: Now in its 18th year, Comms Connect 2023 will feature over 60 expert local and international speakers, with keynotes from USA and Hong Kong, alongside leaders from Singapore, Canada and New Zealand. The world-class conference program will be supported by over 70 leading vendors and suppliers on the exhibition floor and 6 pre-conference workshops run by our association partners, ARCIA and ACCF/TCCA.

item.title: ARBS 2024
item.description: ARBS 2024 is expected to return to pre-COVID levels hosting over 300 exhibitors and more than 9000 visitors. A seminar program will run alongside the exhibition, and visitors can also secure a spot at the ARBS Industry Awards presentation dinner.

item.title: WBT optical fibre patch cords
item.description: Warren & Brown Technologies (WBT) has an extensive range of high-performance optical fibre patch cords available in single mode, multimode, simplex and duplex.

item.title: Treoflex-UV drive cables
item.description: Designed primarily to supply power to motors from variable frequency drives, the Treoflex-UV drive cable range maintains electromagnetic compatibility throughout its rated life.

item.title: Fatek M series modular programmable logic controller
item.description: The Fatek M series modular programmable logic controller (PLC) offers flexibility and scalability for a wide range of industrial applications.

item.title: HARTING Han-Modular Push-In and Han ORV3
item.description: HARTING's new solutions for energy transformation are the Han-Modular Push-In and Han ORV3.

item.title: Minimal Size, Maximum Durability
item.description: Go beyond the limits with Moxa EDS-2000/G2000 EL Series industrial Ethernet unmanaged switches. Reliable, flexible and easy to deploy for a variety of industrial applications.

item.title: Sustainability that works
item.description: Discover the world's most efficient climate control solutions and smart service concepts to help reduce the carbon footprint of your machines and systems | Learn more from Rittal
